messages.content: What is ComfyUI-Allor and what are its primary features?

ComfyUI-Allor is a high-performance ComfyUI plugin designed for image processing with over 90 nodes and numerous parameters for various needs. It supports transparency and multi-image processing across all modules and nodes, is fully configurable, and the majority of its operations are implemented in tensor space.
How can I install and update ComfyUI-Allor?

You can find the instructions for installing and updating ComfyUI-Allor in the [documentation](https://nourepide.github.io/ComfyUI-Allor-Doc/). The documentation includes a dedicated section on installation and another on updating, including troubleshooting steps for potential problems.
What happened to the repository images in the Allor recent update?

In a recent update, the Allor repository was rebased to remove all images from the history, which resulted in a significant reduction in its size. This change, however, may cause issues with updates for some users. The documentation includes guidance on how to troubleshoot these issues.
How can I contribute to ComfyUI-Allor?

ComfyUI Allor is an open source project, and there are several ways to contribute. You can suggest ideas for improvement on GitHub, report bugs with steps to reproduce them, or make pull requests if you have made changes to the plugin's code.
Can I use ComfyUI-Allor on a cloud service like Google Colab?

Yes, you can use ComfyUI-Allor on a cloud service. There is a Jupiter Notebook available [here](resources/allor.ipynb). If you have a subscription to Colab Pro, you can run it in [Google Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1qOALtMEG_f6DN0o9mxUih6x_7PTPYM8X?usp=sharing).
What fonts and models are required to create the logo using ComfyUI?

To create the ComfyUI logo, you need to install plugins, load fonts [Overlock SC](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Overlock+SC) and [Merienda](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Merienda), and download models [RealESRNet_x4plus.pth](https://github.com/xinntao/Real-ESRGAN/releases/download/v0.1.1/RealESRNet_x4plus.pth), [AOM3A1B_orangemixs.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/WarriorMama777/OrangeMixs/resolve/main/Models/AbyssOrangeMix3/AOM3A1B_orangemixs.safetensors), and [orangemix.vae.pt](https://huggingface.co/WarriorMama777/OrangeMixs/resolve/main/VAEs/orangemix.vae.pt), and load these into the required folders. The logo image should be dragged and dropped into ComfyUI or loaded via JSON [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Nourepide/ComfyUI-Allor-Res/c4147e55cf8ec26ca79fe3df6e1af71aca58c19e/v.2/logo_v.2.json).
